DataElement.preferredName: Loss of Heterozygosity Finding Array Identifier BioAssayArrayType
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A genetic abnormality that is characterized by the partial loss of specific gene function via the deletion or mutation of one allele of a heterozygous gene locus. When this occurs at a tumor suppressor gene locus in a phenotype that already contains an abnormal allele, loss of heterozygosity can contribute to neoplastic transformation.:The result of an examination or inquiry._An orderly arrangement. (from the American Heritage Dictionary):One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing._array design identifier, given by the manufactures of the array: eg: U133plus2.0 by Affy manufactures

When this occurs at a tumor suppressor gene locus in a phenotype that already contains an abnormal allele, loss of heterozygosity can contribute to neoplastic transformation.:The result of an examination or inquiry._An orderly arrangement. ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A genetic abnormality that is characterized by the partial loss of specific gene function via the deletion or mutation of one allele of a heterozygous gene locus. When this occurs at a tumor suppressor gene locus in a phenotype that already contains an abnormal allele, loss of heterozygosity can contribute to neoplastic transformation.:The result of an examination or inquiry.

Concepts.definition: A genetic variation where gain, loss, or exchange of DNA results in monoallelic loss of function mutations in a diploid cell. In the context of tumor suppressor genes, where a single copy is sufficient for functionality, loss of function for the second allele is associated with tumorigenesis.
The result of an examination or inquiry.

Property.preferredDefinition: An orderly arrangement. (from the American Heritage Dictionary):One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

Concepts.definition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 10/18/12 jc  Release caIntegrator v2.1 model content per model owner (Rashmi Srinivasa).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: array design identifier, given by the manufactures of the array: eg: U133plus2.0 by Affy manufactures

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A molecular biology device that utilizes a set of defined cDNA clones attached in a specific grid arrangement to a solid support for nucleic acid hybridization assays in gene mapping studies or in determining gene sequences, sequence variations, or gene expression patterns.

Concepts.definition: A molecular biology device that utilizes a set of defined cDNA clones attached in a specific grid arrangement to a solid support for nucleic acid hybridization assays in gene mapping studies or in determining gene sequences, sequence variations, or gene expression patterns.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Affymetrics Human Genome U133 Plus 2.0 Array

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
